docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. doctors are fielding a spate of calls from expectant mothers who recently traveled to countries affected by the Zika virus and fear possible exposure to the mosquito-borne infection linked to a spike in fetal brain damage in Brazil.

headline.main: U.S. Moms-To-Be Seek Reassurance About Zika After Trips Abroad
headline.print_headline: U.S. Moms-To-Be Seek Reassurance About Zika After Trips Abroad

docs.snippet: U.S. doctors are fielding a spate of calls from expectant mothers who recently traveled to countries affected by the Zika virus and fear possible exposure to the mosquito-borne infection linked to a spike in fetal brain damage in Brazil.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women in El Salvador and Colombia are being cautioned to avoid pregnancy due to the potentially dangerous Zika virus, but little access to contraception or abortion and pregnancies from rape leave many women unable to heed that advice, campaigners say.

headline.main: Advice to Delay Pregnancy Due to Zika Virus Is Naive, Activists Say
headline.print_headline: Advice to Delay Pregnancy Due to Zika Virus Is Naive, Activists Say

docs.snippet: Women in El Salvador and Colombia are being cautioned to avoid pregnancy due to the potentially dangerous Zika virus, but little access to contraception or abortion and pregnancies from rape leave many women unable to heed that advice, campaigners...

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rejected North Dakota's bid to revive a restrictive Republican-backed law struck down by a lower court that would ban most abortions once a fetal heartbeat can be detected, as early as six weeks after conception.

headline.main: U.S. Top Court Declines to Revive North Dakota Abortion Limits
headline.print_headline: U.S. Top Court Declines to Revive North Dakota Abortion Limits

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rejected North Dakota's bid to revive a restrictive Republican-backed law struck down by a lower court that would ban most abortions once a fetal heartbeat can be detected, as early as six weeks after conception.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court refused on Monday to review lower court rulings overturning North Dakota's ban on abortion at six weeks of pregnancy — before many women know they're pregnant.

headline.main: Justices Won't Let North Dakota Enforce Tough Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: Justices Won't Let North Dakota Enforce Tough Abortion Law

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court refused on Monday to review lower court rulings overturning North Dakota's ban on abortion at six weeks of pregnancy — before many women know they're pregnant.

docs.lead_paragraph: A South African mayor has awarded college scholarships to 16 young women for remaining virgins to encourage others to be "pure and focus on school," her spokesman said Sunday.

headline.main: S. African Mayor Awards Scholarships to Virgin Women
headline.print_headline: S. African Mayor Awards Scholarships to Virgin Women

docs.snippet: A South African mayor has awarded college scholarships to 16 young women for remaining virgins to encourage others to be "pure and focus on school," her spokesman said Sunday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The rapid spread of the mosquito-borne virus, which has been linked to a surge in malformed infants, has forced Latin America to take extreme health measures.

headline.main: El Salvador Advises Against Pregnancy Until 2018 in Answer to Zika Fears
headline.print_headline: Pregnancy Delay Is Urged to Combat Zika

docs.snippet: The rapid spread of the mosquito-borne virus, which has been linked to a surge in malformed infants, has forced Latin America to take extreme health measures.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers discuss the risks and benefits of both settings.
docs.snippet: Readers discuss the risks and benefits of both settings.

docs.lead_paragraph: By studying the microscopic bacteria that bloom on our bodies after we die, scientists hope to unlock surprising mysteries of the departed.
docs.abstract: Researchers hope study of necrobiome, collection of bacteria, fungi and insects that thrive on corpse after death, will help pathologists better pinpoint post-mortem interval, amount of time that has elapsed since death and has proved notoriously difficult to determine; effort called Human Postmortem Microbiome project has received $850,000 grant from National Institute of Justice.
docs.snippet: By studying the microscopic bacteria that bloom on our bodies after we die, scientists hope to unlock surprising mysteries of the departed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The blocked law, adopted last April, would ban the most common method used in second-trimester abortions, known as dilation and evacuation.

headline.main: Kansas Court of Appeals Voids Restrictive 2015 Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: In Kansas, Court Voids State Curbs on Abortion

docs.abstract: Kansas Court of Appeals, by issuing split decision, rules that state Constitution protects woman's right to abortion;  7-7 vote means lower court ruling, which blocked enforcement of 2015 state law banning most common method used in second-trimester abortion, must be upheld; tie among justices indicates issue is likely to be revisited, at state Supreme Court level.
docs.snippet: The blocked law, adopted last April, would ban the most common method used in second-trimester abortions, known as dilation and evacuation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention added eight destinations to a list of countries that pregnant women should avoid to prevent infection.

headline.main: C.D.C. Issues Travel Alert for 8 More Locations Over Zika Virus
headline.print_headline: U.S. Expands Travel Alert Over Zika Virus

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention officials add Barbados, Bolivia, Ecuador, Guadeloupe, St Martin, Guyana, Samoa and Cape Verde to list of places pregnant women should avoid due to Zika virus, which is known to cause brain damage in newborns.
docs.snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention added eight destinations to a list of countries that pregnant women should avoid to prevent infection.
